p: The M2 population of the wound at the 10 th day was analyzed by flow cytometry and we observed no difference between the IL-10 −/− mice and IL-10 −/− mice treated with EPA-rich oil (Fig. 4B). These results suggest that the increase of M2 in the animals supplemented with EPA may be related to the increase of IL-10 at 3 and 7 days after tissue injury.
